subject: Communication
title: How the Brain Processes Speech
description: A quick, practical guide to How the Brain Processes Speech.

hook.text: Your brain processes speech at 125-250 words per minute. You think at 1,000-3,000 words per minute.

buildup.text: Wernicke's area in the left temporal lobe is the brain's primary speech comprehension center.

discovery.text: Listening engages multiple brain regions: auditory cortex (sound), Wernicke's area (meaning), prefrontal cortex.

twist.text: The speed gap between speech and thought creates spare mental capacity.

climax.text: Expert listeners use spare capacity productively: summarizing, connecting ideas, and formulating questions instead of.

punchline.text: Your brain outpaces speech. Discipline that speed, and you become a master.

quiz.question: What creates the 'spare capacity' that causes minds to wander during listening?
options: The gap between speech speed and thinking speed
